intro: Coussarea nigrescens, commonly known as the blackening coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green in color. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with four or five petals. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns black when mature, giving the plant its common name.
